documentation:
Amazon CloudWatch Application Insights for .NET and SQL Server

Amazon CloudWatch Application Insights for .NET and SQL Server is a service that helps you detect common problems with your .NET and SQL Server-based applications. It enables you to pinpoint the source of issues in your applications (built with technologies such as Microsoft IIS, .NET, and Microsoft SQL Server), by providing key insights into detected problems.

After you onboard your application, CloudWatch Application Insights for .NET and SQL Server identifies, recommends, and sets up metrics and logs. It continuously analyzes and correlates your metrics and logs for unusual behavior to surface actionable problems with your application. For example, if your application is slow and unresponsive and leading to HTTP 500 errors in your Application Load Balancer (ALB), Application Insights informs you that a memory pressure problem with your SQL Server database is occurring. It bases this analysis on impactful metrics and log errors.

CreateApplication.documentation: Adds an application that is created from a resource group.
CreateApplication.name: CreateApplication

CreateComponent.documentation: Creates a custom component by grouping similar standalone instances to monitor.
CreateComponent.name: CreateComponent

DeleteApplication.documentation: Removes the specified application from monitoring. Does not delete the application.
DeleteApplication.name: DeleteApplication

DeleteComponent.documentation: Ungroups a custom component. When you ungroup custom components, all applicable monitors that are set up for the component are removed and the instances revert to their standalone status.
DeleteComponent.name: DeleteComponent

DeleteLogPattern.documentation: Removes the specified log pattern from a LogPatternSet.
DeleteLogPattern.name: DeleteLogPattern

DescribeComponent.documentation: Describes a component and lists the resources that are grouped together in a component.
DescribeComponent.name: DescribeComponent

DescribeComponentConfiguration.documentation: Describes the monitoring configuration of the component.
DescribeComponentConfiguration.name: DescribeComponentConfiguration

DescribeComponentConfigurationRecommenda.documentation: Describes the recommended monitoring configuration of the component.
DescribeComponentConfigurationRecommenda.name: DescribeComponentConfigurationRecommendation

DescribeLogPattern.documentation: Describe a specific log pattern from a LogPatternSet.
DescribeLogPattern.name: DescribeLogPattern

DescribeObservation.documentation: Describes an anomaly or error with the application.
DescribeObservation.name: DescribeObservation

DescribeProblemObservations.documentation: Describes the anomalies or errors associated with the problem.
DescribeProblemObservations.name: DescribeProblemObservations

ListApplications.documentation: Lists the IDs of the applications that you are monitoring.
ListApplications.name: ListApplications

ListComponents.documentation: Lists the auto-grouped, standalone, and custom components of the application.
ListComponents.name: ListComponents

ListConfigurationHistory.documentation:
Lists the INFO, WARN, and ERROR events for periodic configuration updates performed by Application Insights. Examples of events represented are:

  • INFO: creating a new alarm or updating an alarm threshold.

  • WARN: alarm not created due to insufficient data points used to predict thresholds.

  • ERROR: alarm not created due to permission errors or exceeding quotas.
ListConfigurationHistory.name: ListConfigurationHistory

ListLogPatternSets.documentation: Lists the log pattern sets in the specific application.
ListLogPatternSets.name: ListLogPatternSets

ListLogPatterns.documentation: Lists the log patterns in the specific log LogPatternSet.
ListLogPatterns.name: ListLogPatterns

ListTagsForResource.documentation: Retrieve a list of the tags (keys and values) that are associated with a specified application. A tag is a label that you optionally define and associate with an application. Each tag consists of a required tag key and an optional associated tag value. A tag key is a general label that acts as a category for more specific tag values. A tag value acts as a descriptor within a tag key.
ListTagsForResource.name: ListTagsForResource

TagResource.documentation:
Add one or more tags (keys and values) to a specified application. A tag is a label that you optionally define and associate with an application. Tags can help you categorize and manage application in different ways, such as by purpose, owner, environment, or other criteria.

Each tag consists of a required tag key and an associated tag value, both of which you define. A tag key is a general label that acts as a category for more specific tag values. A tag value acts as a descriptor within a tag key.
TagResource.name: TagResource

UntagResource.documentation: Remove one or more tags (keys and values) from a specified application.
UntagResource.name: UntagResource

UpdateComponent.documentation: Updates the custom component name and/or the list of resources that make up the component.
UpdateComponent.name: UpdateComponent

UpdateComponentConfiguration.documentation: Updates the monitoring configurations for the component. The configuration input parameter is an escaped JSON of the configuration and should match the schema of what is returned by DescribeComponentConfigurationRecommendation.
UpdateComponentConfiguration.name: UpdateComponentConfiguration

ApplicationComponent.documentation: Describes a standalone resource or similarly grouped resources that the application is made up of.

Monitor.documentation: Indicates whether the application component is monitored.

ResourceType.documentation: The resource type. Supported resource types include EC2 instances, Auto Scaling group, Classic ELB, Application ELB, and SQS Queue.

Tier.documentation: The stack tier of the application component.

CWEMonitorEnabled.documentation: Indicates whether Application Insights can listen to CloudWatch events for the application resources, such as instance terminated, failed deployment, and others.

OpsCenterEnabled.documentation: Indicates whether Application Insights will create opsItems for any problem detected by Application Insights for an application.

OpsItemSNSTopicArn.documentation: The SNS topic provided to Application Insights that is associated to the created opsItems to receive SNS notifications for opsItem updates.

Remarks.documentation:
The issues on the user side that block Application Insights from successfully monitoring an application. Example remarks include:

  • “Configuring application, detected 1 Errors, 3 Warnings”

  • “Configuring application, detected 1 Unconfigured Components”

ResourceGroupName.documentation: The name of the resource group used for the application.

BadRequestException.documentation: The request is not understood by the server.

EventDetail.documentation: The details of the event in plain text.

EventResourceName.documentation: The name of the resource Application Insights attempted to configure.

EventResourceType.documentation: The resource type that Application Insights attempted to configure, for example, CLOUDWATCH_ALARM.

EventStatus.documentation: The status of the configuration update event. Possible values include INFO, WARN, and ERROR.

MonitoredResourceARN.documentation: The resource monitored by Application Insights.

CWEMonitorEnabled.documentation: Indicates whether Application Insights can listen to CloudWatch events for the application resources, such as instance terminated, failed deployment, and others.

OpsCenterEnabled.documentation: When set to true, creates opsItems for any problems detected on an application.

OpsItemSNSTopicArn.documentation: The SNS topic provided to Application Insights that is associated to the created opsItem. Allows you to receive notifications for updates to the opsItem.

Tags.documentation: List of tags to add to the application. tag key (Key) and an associated tag value (Value). The maximum length of a tag key is 128 characters. The maximum length of a tag value is 256 characters.

ResourceList.documentation: The list of resource ARNs that belong to the component.

PatternSetName.documentation: The name of the log pattern set.
The name of the log pattern set.

Tier.documentation: The tier of the application component. Supported tiers include DOT_NET_CORE, DOT_NET_WORKER, DOT_NET_WEB, SQL_SERVER, and DEFAULT.

ComponentConfiguration.documentation: The recommended configuration settings of the component. The value is the escaped JSON of the configuration.
The configuration settings of the component. The value is the escaped JSON of the configuration.

Monitor.documentation: Indicates whether the application component is monitored.

Tier.documentation: The tier of the application component. Supported tiers include DOT_NET_CORE, DOT_NET_WORKER, DOT_NET_WEB, SQL_SERVER, and DEFAULT

ResourceList.documentation: The list of resource ARNs that belong to the component.

PatternSetName.documentation: The name of the log pattern set.

InternalServerException.documentation: The server encountered an internal error and is unable to complete the request.

MaxResults.documentation: The maximum number of results to return in a single call. To retrieve the remaining results, make another call with the returned NextToken value.

NextToken.documentation: The token to request the next page of results.
The token used to retrieve the next page of results. This value is null when there are no more results to return.

MaxResults.documentation: The maximum number of results to return in a single call. To retrieve the remaining results, make another call with the returned NextToken value.

NextToken.documentation: The token to request the next page of results.
The token to request the next page of results.

EventStatus.documentation: The status of the configuration update event. Possible values include INFO, WARN, and ERROR.

MaxResults.documentation: The maximum number of results returned by ListConfigurationHistory in paginated output. When this parameter is used, ListConfigurationHistory returns only MaxResults in a single page along with a NextToken response element. The remaining results of the initial request can be seen by sending another ListConfigurationHistory request with the returned NextToken value. If this parameter is not used, then ListConfigurationHistory returns all results.

NextToken.documentation: The NextToken value returned from a previous paginated ListConfigurationHistory request where MaxResults was used and the results exceeded the value of that parameter. Pagination continues from the end of the previous results that returned the NextToken value. This value is null when there are no more results to return.

ResourceGroupName.documentation: Resource group to which the application belongs.

EventList.documentation: The list of configuration events and their corresponding details.

NextToken.documentation: The NextToken value to include in a future ListConfigurationHistory request. When the results of a ListConfigurationHistory request exceed MaxResults, this value can be used to retrieve the next page of results. This value is null when there are no more results to return.

MaxResults.documentation: The maximum number of results to return in a single call. To retrieve the remaining results, make another call with the returned NextToken value.

NextToken.documentation: The token to request the next page of results.
The token used to retrieve the next page of results. This value is null when there are no more results to return.

MaxResults.documentation: The maximum number of results to return in a single call. To retrieve the remaining results, make another call with the returned NextToken value.

NextToken.documentation: The token to request the next page of results.

PatternSetName.documentation: The name of the log pattern set.

NextToken.documentation: The token used to retrieve the next page of results. This value is null when there are no more results to return.

EndTime.documentation: The time when the problem ended, in epoch seconds. If not specified, problems within the past seven days are returned.

MaxResults.documentation: The maximum number of results to return in a single call. To retrieve the remaining results, make another call with the returned NextToken value.

NextToken.documentation: The token to request the next page of results.

StartTime.documentation: The time when the problem was detected, in epoch seconds. If you don't specify a time frame for the request, problems within the past seven days are returned.

NextToken.documentation: The token used to retrieve the next page of results. This value is null when there are no more results to return.

ResourceARN.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the application that you want to retrieve tag information for.

Tags.documentation: An array that lists all the tags that are associated with the application. Each tag consists of a required tag key (Key) and an associated tag value (Value).

LogPattern.documentation: An object that defines the log patterns that belongs to a LogPatternSet.

Pattern.documentation: A regular expression that defines the log pattern. A log pattern can contains at many as 50 characters, and it cannot be empty.

PatternName.documentation: The name of the log pattern. A log pattern name can contains at many as 50 characters, and it cannot be empty. The characters can be Unicode letters, digits or one of the following symbols: period, dash, underscore.

PatternSetName.documentation: The name of the log pattern. A log pattern name can contains at many as 30 characters, and it cannot be empty. The characters can be Unicode letters, digits or one of the following symbols: period, dash, underscore.

Observation.documentation: Describes an anomaly or error with the application.

CloudWatchEventDetailType.documentation: The detail type of the CloudWatch Event-based observation, for example, EC2 Instance State-change Notification.

CloudWatchEventId.documentation: The ID of the CloudWatch Event-based observation related to the detected problem.

CloudWatchEventSource.documentation: The source of the CloudWatch Event.

CodeDeployApplication.documentation: The CodeDeploy application to which the deployment belongs.

CodeDeployDeploymentGroup.documentation: The deployment group to which the CodeDeploy deployment belongs.

CodeDeployDeploymentId.documentation: The deployment ID of the CodeDeploy-based observation related to the detected problem.

CodeDeployInstanceGroupId.documentation: The instance group to which the CodeDeploy instance belongs.

CodeDeployState.documentation: The status of the CodeDeploy deployment, for example SUCCESS or FAILURE.

Ec2State.documentation: The state of the instance, such as STOPPING or TERMINATING.

EndTime.documentation: The time when the observation ended, in epoch seconds.

HealthEventArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS Health Event-based observation.

HealthEventDescription.documentation: The description of the AWS Health event provided by the service, such as Amazon EC2.

HealthEventTypeCategory.documentation: The category of the AWS Health event, such as issue.

HealthEventTypeCode.documentation: The type of the AWS Health event, for example, AWS_EC2_POWER_CONNECTIVITY_ISSUE.

HealthService.documentation: The service to which the AWS Health Event belongs, such as EC2.

LineTime.documentation: The timestamp in the CloudWatch Logs that specifies when the matched line occurred.

SourceARN.documentation: The source resource ARN of the observation.

StartTime.documentation: The time when the observation was first detected, in epoch seconds.

Unit.documentation: The unit of the source observation metric.

Value.documentation: The value of the source observation metric.

XRayErrorPercent.documentation: The X-Ray request error percentage for this node.

XRayFaultPercent.documentation: The X-Ray request fault percentage for this node.

XRayNodeName.documentation: The name of the X-Ray node.

XRayNodeType.documentation: The type of the X-Ray node.

XRayRequestAverageLatency.documentation: The X-Ray node request average latency for this node.

XRayRequestCount.documentation: The X-Ray request count for this node.

XRayThrottlePercent.documentation: The X-Ray request throttle percentage for this node.

Problem.documentation: Describes a problem that is detected by correlating observations.

EndTime.documentation: The time when the problem ended, in epoch seconds.

Feedback.documentation: Feedback provided by the user about the problem.

Insights.documentation: A detailed analysis of the problem using machine learning.

ResourceGroupName.documentation: The name of the resource group affected by the problem.

SeverityLevel.documentation: A measure of the level of impact of the problem.

StartTime.documentation: The time when the problem started, in epoch seconds.

ObservationList.documentation: The list of observations related to the problem.

ResourceInUseException.documentation: The resource is already created or in use.

ResourceNotFoundException.documentation: The resource does not exist in the customer account.

Tag.documentation:
An object that defines the tags associated with an application. A tag is a label that you optionally define and associate with an application. Tags can help you categorize and manage resources in different ways, such as by purpose, owner, environment, or other criteria.

Each tag consists of a required tag key and an associated tag value, both of which you define. A tag key is a general label that acts as a category for a more specific tag value. A tag value acts as a descriptor within a tag key. A tag key can contain as many as 128 characters. A tag value can contain as many as 256 characters. The characters can be Unicode letters, digits, white space, or one of the following symbols: _ . : / = + -. The following additional restrictions apply to tags:

  • Tag keys and values are case sensitive.

  • For each associated resource, each tag key must be unique and it can have only one value.

  • The aws: prefix is reserved for use by AWS; you can’t use it in any tag keys or values that you define. In addition, you can't edit or remove tag keys or values that use this prefix.

Key.documentation: One part of a key-value pair that defines a tag. The maximum length of a tag key is 128 characters. The minimum length is 1 character.

Value.documentation: The optional part of a key-value pair that defines a tag. The maximum length of a tag value is 256 characters. The minimum length is 0 characters. If you don't want an application to have a specific tag value, don't specify a value for this parameter.

ResourceARN.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the application that you want to add one or more tags to.

Tags.documentation: A list of tags that to add to the application. A tag consists of a required tag key (Key) and an associated tag value (Value). The maximum length of a tag key is 128 characters. The maximum length of a tag value is 256 characters.

TagsAlreadyExistException.documentation: Tags are already registered for the specified application ARN.

TooManyTagsException.documentation: The number of the provided tags is beyond the limit, or the number of total tags you are trying to attach to the specified resource exceeds the limit.

ResourceName.documentation: The name of the resource with too many tags.

ResourceARN.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the application that you want to remove one or more tags from.

TagKeys.documentation:
The tags (tag keys) that you want to remove from the resource. When you specify a tag key, the action removes both that key and its associated tag value.

To remove more than one tag from the application, append the TagKeys parameter and argument for each additional tag to remove, separated by an ampersand.

CWEMonitorEnabled.documentation: Indicates whether Application Insights can listen to CloudWatch events for the application resources, such as instance terminated, failed deployment, and others.

OpsCenterEnabled.documentation: When set to true, creates opsItems for any problems detected on an application.

OpsItemSNSTopicArn.documentation: The SNS topic provided to Application Insights that is associated to the created opsItem. Allows you to receive notifications for updates to the opsItem.

RemoveSNSTopic.documentation: Disassociates the SNS topic from the opsItem created for detected problems.

ComponentConfiguration.documentation: The configuration settings of the component. The value is the escaped JSON of the configuration. For more information about the JSON format, see Working with JSON. You can send a request to DescribeComponentConfigurationRecommendation to see the recommended configuration for a component. For the complete format of the component configuration file, see Component Configuration.

Monitor.documentation: Indicates whether the application component is monitored.

Tier.documentation: The tier of the application component. Supported tiers include DOT_NET_WORKER, DOT_NET_WEB, DOT_NET_CORE, SQL_SERVER, and DEFAULT.

ResourceList.documentation: The list of resource ARNs that belong to the component.

PatternSetName.documentation: The name of the log pattern set.
